Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh gets a wicket with his first ball in a T20 World Cup!
Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya are a good pair for India to have at the middle right now.
Rohit Sharma carries Virat Kohli in his shoulders after the epic win
India won by 4 wickets (with 0 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: India have the highest run-rate in the powerplay (8.63) and at the death (11.50) in T20I cricket since the 2021 World Cup.
Pakistan are at 7.07 in the powerplay (better only than Sri Lanka, UAE and Namibia out of the teams at this tournament)
The coin falls in India's favour and Rohit Sharma is happy to chase a target.
Babar says he would also have wanted to bowl, which goes with the way T20 is played these days.
Post-Match Reflections: The world knew one clear truth. VIRAT KOHLI IS STRAIGHT FIRE.
Hardik Pandya expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Rohit Sharma remarked that winning the series was a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: La Nina first threatened to wash out the India vs Pakistan game altogether. But instead it created a thrilling atmosphere for the biggest event on the cricket calendar.
The MCG pitch has too much bounce.
Pakistan were 32 for 2 in their powerplay. INDIA ARE 31 FOR 4!
Virat Kohli isn't a man. He is a feeling.
Others: The MCG has a seating capacity of over 100,000 people.
The match was played in perfect weather with clear blue skies.
